name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

enum.description: Action to take when no token is found.
enum.caption: On No Token
enum.name: onNoToken

string.description: Application name to communicate to google.

string.name: applicationName

string.name: consumerKey

string.description: The OAuth consumer secret.
string.caption: Consumer Secret
string.name: consumerSecret

string.caption: Scope
string.name: scope

globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.
globalRef.caption: Config Reference

cloud-connector.description: Connector for accessing, creating and modifying google docs spreadsheets. This connector uses OAuth2 for authentication.
cloud-connector.caption: Google Spreadsheets

string.description: Any value that you wish to be sent with the callback.
string.caption: State
string.name: state

string.description: The URL defined by the Service Provider to obtain an access token.
string.caption: Access Token Url
string.name: accessTokenUrl

string.caption: Authorization Url
string.name: authorizationUrl

string.description: The id of the access token that will be used to authenticate the call.
string.caption: Access Token Id
string.name: accessTokenId

string.caption: Title
string.name: title

string.caption: Access Token Id
string.name: accessTokenId

string.description: The title of the spreadsheet that will contain the new worksheet.
string.caption: Spreadsheet
string.name: spreadsheet

integer.description: Google's api allows for several spreadsheet to have the same name. In this cases it returns a list with all the ones matching the given title. Use this optional attribute to specify the zero-based list index of the want you want to use.
integer.caption: Spreadsheet Index
integer.name: spreadsheetIndex

integer.description: The initial number of rows you want the worksheet to have.
